intro: Rhodamnia trinervia var. uniflora, commonly known as the single-flowered rhodamnia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in natural habitats.
